benchmark_details.name: XSID (Cross-lingual Slot and Intent Detection)
benchmark_details.overview: XSID is a new benchmark for cross-lingual Slot and Intent Detection in 13 languages from 6 language families, specifically aimed at improving Spoken Language Understanding (SLU) for low-resource languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide evaluation data that supports the recognition of user intents and slot-filling tasks in spoken language understanding across various languages.

data.source: The dataset consists of translated utterances adapted from existing datasets (Snips and Facebook) and newly annotated data for 13 languages.
data.annotation: Annotations for intents and slots were performed by native speakers in accordance with specific annotation guidelines to ensure consistency across the dataset.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on predictions compared to ground truth labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in accurately detecting slots and classifying intents.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through inter-annotator agreement, achieving a high Fleiss Kappa score.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset contains utterances generated by demographic groups corresponding to the languages included.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All collected data is anonymized and no personal information is included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data is released under CC-BY-SA license.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Data collection followed ethical guidelines as defined by the participating organizations.
